entry.title: Conclusion
entry.content:
# Thank you !!
```python import pprint
tnx = "Looking forward to your thoughts and discussion"
pprint.pprint({tnx}) ```

entry.title: Ideas
entry.content:
## 3. Ideas !
<small>
Introduce Rshiny apps that we can work on putting inside the Django stuff that has been created. This is a project I wanted to work towards at pacific radiology. Give the example of the site that does this. We can build all the statiscal stuff we require here. Automation pipelines. I brought skills onboard here. Visualization.
-- Another powerful tool is launching updated Excel documents. Data entry, use of Excel and even google sheets for collecting information from the wetlab. Python package and alert scripts.
</small>

entry.title: Position_profile
entry.content: ## 2. Position Profile ! Domain knowledge (Data Science) is replaced with Biology (Bioinformatics) and my aim is to integrate my work experience in data science with my college background in Genetics and Immunology. -- Responsibilities of the role and experience. - Developing Bioinformatics software. - Python and R package development and creating functions. - Large volumes of biological data - Experience: Cassandra, Spark, AWS, Google bigquery. - Bioinformatics : Large scale biological data. - Data extraction and integration: - Experience : Reporting and automation. - SQL and NoSQL experience. - Ensuring high quality data. - Experience : Test driven development. - Help with training colleagues across the business. -- Technical skills with examples. - Python and R developer. - Building fucntions and contributing to our aanalytics packages (R and python) to be used by the analytics team. - Experience with web development. - Used Flask before but have not created Django apps previously. - I'm hopeful my python knowledge will help me learn this skill fast. - RShiny visualizations and javascript libraries. - Learning javascript and experimenting (such as with this presentation) with more javascript. - Comfortable with Linux and windows. - Number of years experience working on ubuntu machines and AWS - Bioinformatics tools. - FYP in Genetics using tools like Blast and a custom tool to analyze GC content in genomes. - Very comfortable with SQL and NoSQL. -- ##### 2. Position Profile overview. I'm really looking forward to going back and using my data science skills developed in the last number of years in biology. I feel my commercial experience has been very beneficial in terms of working towards tight deadlines and ensuring high quality data. My experience in NZ has also been very beneficial in terms of developing my soft skills and working and presenting findings to many different business faculties.

entry.title: Career_history
entry.content: ### 1. Career history: College ! Biology | Data Science :-------------------------:|:-------------------------: | BSc Genetics (UCC) 2010, MSc Immunology and Global Health (NUIM) 2012 | HDip Data Science and Analytics (CIT) (2014) -- - **_BSc Genetics 2010_** - Genomics, Bioinformatics, Statistics, Molecular biology. - Final year project in bioinformatics (investigating bacterial pseudogenes in failed horizontal gene transfer events) -- - **_MSc Immunology and Global Health 2012_** - Epidemiology and disease modelling, molecular immunology, proteomics/bioinformatics. - Master thesis. Preperation of a genomic library of a virulent e-coli strain known to be associated with Crohn's disease in humans. -- - **_HDip Data Science and Analytics 2014_** - Mathematics, statistics, distributed computing, Python and R programming, machine learning. - Thesis. Sentiment analysis and opinion mining of Twitter using a Naive Bayes classifier. -- Twitter Sentiment Analysis on real time data. The above graph represents a time series of sentiment over time for the world cup final in 2014.I gave presentations on this algorithm and the thesis in CIT and the CSO in Cork. --- ### 1. Career history. Work ! ##### Experience working in data science - I joined Xanadu consultancy in 2014 as a Data Scientist. - Initally worked in the "Data Analytics" team (2 years). - Then worked in "Data Products" team (>9 months). -- ##### Example of some projects I worked on at Xanadu ##### Data Analytics Team - Haproxy log files - setup processes in MongoDB, later Google Bigquery - R package for data analytics team - Personalization (twitter, commissions) - Migration - Many other data projects, including fraud detection, LTV, Churn etc. - Prices analytics (NFTN tool). -- ##### Example of some projects I worked on at Xanadu ##### Data Products Team (~9 months) - Bonus engine - The above image is for a 50 - sdsdsds - Prices analytics (NFTN tool V2). -- Worked in New Zealand as a BA/Data Scientist. - Business analytics on radiology data. - The above image is for a 50 (% fragment %} - sdsdsds - Prices analytics (NFTN tool V2). -- ##### 1. Career history and skills relevant for Nuritas How I feel some of the projects are relevant to Nuritas ! I feel I have a strong background in bioligcal sciences and informatics. In the next section when reviewing the position description I'll describe in more detail the tools used.

entry.title: Welcome
entry.content: ## Shane Whelan Interview for Nuritas Bioinformatician. image source : https://www.olay.com/en-us/skin-care-guide/amino-peptides --- ## Topics. - **1. Career history:** - Previous work experience and projects relevant to Nuritas. - **2. Position profile:** - How I believe my experience and background will be a good fit. - Tools used and key competencies. - **3. Ideas:** - Concepts and ideas that I believe might be of interest to the team
entry.summary: ## Shane Whelan Interview for Nuritas Bioinformatician.
